snippet: In a prime-time address, President Obama bluntly acknowledged heightened worries after the attacks in Paris and in San Bernardino, Calif., and urged Americans not to give in to fear.
abstract: Pres Obama addresses nation from Oval Office and tries to reassure Americans that their government has capabilities to address evolving terrorist threat in light of attack in San Bernardino, Calif; Obama says US will intensify its military efforts against Islamic State group, and calls on Americans not to turn against American Muslims or Muslims as whole due to actions of few; is third speech Obama has delivered from Oval Office, move meant to underscore gravity of subject.

byline.original: By GARDINER HARRIS and MICHAEL D. SHEAR

lead_paragraph: In a prime-time address, President Obama bluntly acknowledged heightened worries after the attacks in Paris and in San Bernardino, Calif., and urged Americans not to give in to fear.

headline.main: Obama Says of Terrorist Threat: ‘We Will Overcome It’
